descriptors.name: user-zoom#descdef-viewport-user-zoomReferenced in:5.8. The user-zoom descriptor The user-scalable property

warnings.name: auto
warnings.prose: The used value is calculated from the other descriptors' values according to the constraining procedure. The user-agent stylesheets recommended in the informative section don’t adequately represent current implementation behaviors. Should there be a more explicit mechanism for switching between UA default behavior and requesting the CSS pixel?

warnings.name: <length>
warnings.prose: A non-negative absolute or relative length.

warnings.name: <percentage>
warnings.prose: A percentage value relative to the width or height of the initial viewport at zoom factor 1.0, for horizontal and vertical lengths respectively. Must be non-negative.

warnings.name: zoom
warnings.prose: The user can interactively change the zoom factor.

values.name: auto
values.prose: The zoom factor is UA-dependent. The UA may use the size of the area of the canvas on which the document is rendered to find that initial zoom factor. See this section for a proposed way of handling auto values for zoom.

warnings.name: fixed
warnings.prose: The user cannot interactively change the zoom factor.

warnings.name: auto
warnings.prose: The UA automatically chooses the orientation based on the device’s normal mode of operation. The UA may choose to change the orientation of the presentation when the device is tilted.

warnings.name: portrait
warnings.prose: The document should be locked to portrait presentation.

warnings.name: landscape
warnings.prose: The document should be locked to landscape presentation.
